Class EventList

  • java.lang.Object
    • EventList

  • public class EventList
extends java.lang.Object
    'EventList' this class is used to manage an ArrayList of events class is used exclusively by the 'Menu' class

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EventList()
      'EventList' is a constructore which initialized the ArrayList - take no parameters

    • Method Detail

      • addEvent

        public void addEvent(Event event)
        'addEvent' this function is used to add an event to the ArrayList
        Parameters:
        event - - event is created by user or during initial event loading - returns nothing

      • removeEvent

        public void removeEvent(Event event)
        'removeEvent' this function is called in order to remove an event from the ArrayList
        Parameters:
        event - - event object was found and passed by menu function - returns nothing

      • print

        public void print()
        'print' prints all event by calling each toString function - takes no arguments - returns nothing

      • deleteSingleEvent

        public void deleteSingleEvent(java.lang.String title,
                              java.time.LocalDate date)
        'deleteSingleEvent' this function is called in order to identify and delete a specific event by user input
        Parameters:
        title - - a 'string' of the title of an event the user wants to delete
        date - - a LocalDate generated by user input - returns nothing

      • deleteAllSingleEventsForASpecificDate

        public void deleteAllSingleEventsForASpecificDate(java.time.LocalDate date)
        'deleteAllSingleEventsForASpecificdate' used to delete all single events for a specific date
        Parameters:
        date - - a LocalDate object used to identify the date to be cleared - returns nothing

      • deleteRepeatingEvents

        public void deleteRepeatingEvents(java.lang.String title)
        'deleteRepeatingEvent' this function is called to delete a 'RepeatingEvent' from the events ArrayList
        Parameters:
        title - - a user entered String used to find the repeating event object - returns nothing

      • getOrderedDays

        public java.util.ArrayList<Event> getOrderedDays(java.time.LocalDate selectedDate)
        'getOrderedDays' this function is used in order to find all events on a specific day
        Parameters:
        selectedDate - - a LocalDate object which provides the date for the desired events
        Returns:
        ArrayList - this array list is sorted chronologically (earliest first) of all events on a specific day

      • checkEvents

        public boolean checkEvents(java.lang.String title,
                           java.lang.String date,
                           java.lang.String startingTime,
                           java.lang.String endingTime)
        'checkEvents' this function is used to see if an event already exists which conflicts with desired time slot
        Parameters:
        title - - a String passed in case future developer wants to check for unique names
        date - - a String passed to identify date of interest
        startingTime - - a String describing a time window we want to know if is available
        endingTime - - a String describing a time window we want to know if is available
        Returns:
        boolean - true if time slot is open, false if there is a time conflict
